Bases: object

intersection results class

__init__()¶
_circle_circle(cir_a, cir_b)¶

upon success, the Intersector.dist property will be set to the distance between the pair of points of intersection dist of zero when circles intersect at just one point

_line_line(ln_a, ln_b)¶
_line_pgon(line, pgon, ignore_backface=False)¶

upon success, the Intersector.dist property will be set to the distance between line.spt and the point of intersection

upon success, the Intersector.dist property will be set to the distance between line.spt and the point of intersection

upon success, the Intersector.dist property will be set to the distance between line.spt and the point of intersection

append(item)¶
clear()¶
intersect(a, b, **kargs)¶

pass in two pieces of decodes geometry (a & b), and i’ll have a go at intersecting them. results will be stored in this xsec object extras (such as distance to intersection points) will be assigned as attributes to this xsec object function returns success, True or False

of(a, b, **kargs)¶
